title: SlopTube & Weaponized Ignorance: How Careless Coverage Hurts
list-title: Intellectually Dishonest, Lazy, Hypocritical Mainstream Media
description: Critique of 'SlopTube' content creators in alternative media, examining how figures like Ethan Klein, Asmin Gold, and Mudahar use 'weaponized ignorance' to cover complex political topics, particularly the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, without research or nuance, spreading misinformation and avoiding accountability.
summary: An essay analyzing how popular internet creators in the 'SlopTube' sphere, such as Ethan Klein, Asmin Gold, and Mudahar, leverage perceived 'ignorance' to cover sensitive political issues like the Israeli-Palestinian conflict carelessly, spreading misinformation and contributing to harmful narratives, and how this practice harms public discourse.

title: Nazis Were Not Socialist or Left-Wing
subtitle: Dispelling the Myth of Nazi Socialism
description: Examines the claim that Nazis were socialist or left-wing, analyzing their ideology, economic policies, and suppression of actual leftists to show why Nazism belongs firmly on the far right.
summary: Despite their name, the National Socialist German Workers' Party, the Nazis were not socialist or left-wing. This article delves into their policies, violent actions against the left, and core ideology to demonstrate why Nazism is a far-right fascist movement, distinct from socialism and communism.

title: Peterson's Reading List Proves His Socialist Claims Wrong
subtitle: He says there are no great socialist intellectuals, but his own must-read list is full of them. Awkward.
description: Investigating the blatant contradiction between Jordan Peterson's claim that no great socialist intellectuals exist and his highly influential reading list, which features numerous prominent leftist thinkers like Orwell, Hemingway, and Vonnegut.
summary: Jordan Peterson claims there are no great socialist intellectuals. This article points out the obvious: his list of books everyone *must* read includes a whole bunch of influential writers who were socialists or leftists, showing his claim is flat-out false.

title: Every Critique of Socialism Can Be Used Against Capitalism
list-title: Every Critique of Socialism Can Be Used Against Capitalism
subtitle: Argues that common criticisms of socialism often apply, sometimes more accurately, to contemporary neoliberal capitalism, exposing system contradictions.
description: This article argues that popular attacks on socialism—like claiming it kills innovation, lacks democracy, or causes famine—can be turned right back against neoliberal capitalism. It shows how taxpayers fund key tech, rich donors control politics via Super PACs, and capitalist countries still suffer widespread hunger. It highlights how capitalism privatizes profits from public risk and relies heavily on state bailouts and subsidies for the rich.
summary: You hear capitalism is great and socialism is awful. This piece flips that script. It takes common criticisms of socialism and shows how they actually fit, often better, with how modern capitalism works, especially the neoliberal kind. Think taxpayer-funded tech profits for corporations, billionaires buying politics, or government bailouts for banks. It argues the system socializes the costs while privatizing the benefits.
